case_vignette: A mother brings her 4-year-old son to his pediatrician. Over the last eight months, her son has been exhibiting several "odd" behaviors. Most importantly, he repeatedly says that he is playing games with a friend named "Steven," though she is certain that he does not exist. She has often found him acting out magical scenarios as though someone else is present, when no one is there.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I keep talking and playing games with my friend "Steven" who my mom says isn't real, and I act out magical stuff like someone else is there with me.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 4-year-old boy.
Have you had any other symptoms or changes in your behavior recently?
My mom says I've been doing these "odd" behaviors for the last eight months.
Have you been taking any medications or supplements?
No, I haven't been taking any medications or supplements.
Do you have any family history of similar symptoms or conditions?
I'm just a little kid, so I don't really know much about my family's health history.
Have you been to any doctors or specialists recently?
Yes, my mom brought me to see my pediatrician.
What did your pediatrician say about your symptoms?
I'm not sure, the doctor talked to my mom about it.
What did your pediatrician recommend for your treatment?
I don't know, the doctor talks to my mom about those things.
Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
